title: High-Temporal Resolution Event Streaming for Electron Counting
content: In the Apollo ultra-fast electron counting camera [1], our novel sparse-readout binary output direct detection sensor streams detection events to FPGAs, which performs real-time super-resolution centroiding to produce dose-fractionated electron counting movie frames that are streamed to the user’s computer at ∼60 frames per second (fps). This optimized hardware-based strategy enables electron counting at a rate of more than one billion electrons per second—dramatically faster than any other large-format camera in electron microscopy—enabling high-resolution cryo-EM across a wide range of imaging conditions [2].
